py_sim.sim.sim_modes module¶

Defines a number of simulation modes that can be used

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.DwaFollower(dynamics: Dynamics[UnicycleStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], controller: Control[UnicycleStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ArcParams], dynamic_params: DynamicsParamType, dwa_params: DwaParams, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[UnicycleStateType], world: World, carrot: LineCarrot, params: SimParameters[UnicycleStateType])¶

Bases: Generic[UnicycleStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], SingleAgentSim[UnicycleStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that uses a vector field for feedback control through a polygon world with a distance measurement

dynamics¶

The dynamics function to be used for simulation

Type:

Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType]

controller¶

The control law to be used during simulation

Type:

Control[UnicycleStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType]

dynamic_params¶

Fixed parameters for the dynamics

Type:

DynamicsParamType

control_params¶

The parameters of the control law to be used in simulation

Type:

ArcParams

vector_field¶

Vector field that the vehicle will use to avoid obstacles while traversing to the goal

Type:

G2GAvoid

world¶

World in which the vehicle is operating

Type:

PolygonWorld

sensor¶

The sensor used for detecting obstacles

Type:

RangeBearingSensor

carrot¶

Provides a carrot to be followed

Type:

LineCarrot

dwa_params¶

Parameters for the DWA algorithm

Type:

DwaParams

dwa_arc¶

The arc parameters for the DWA algorithm

Type:

UnicycleControl

arc_plot¶

The plot for the chosen arc of the DWA algorithm

Type:

sim_plt.ControlArcPlot

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions.

The following updates are performed:

  • Update the goal location if carrot-following

  • Calculate the DWA arc parameters

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

update_plot() → None¶

Plot the default plots as well as the dwa plots

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.NavFieldFollower(dynamics: Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], controller: VectorControl[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType], dynamic_params: DynamicsParamType, control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[LocationStateType], vector_field: VectorField, world: PolygonWorld, sensor: RangeBearingSensor, params: SimParameters[LocationStateType])¶

Bases: Generic[LocationStateType, InputType, ControlParamType, DynamicsParamType], SingleAgentSim[LocationStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that uses a vector field for feedback control through a polygon world with a distance measurement

dynamics¶

The dynamics function to be used for simulation

Type:

Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType]

controller¶

The control law to be used during simulation

Type:

VectorControl[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType]

dynamic_params¶

Fixed parameters for the dynamics

Type:

DynamicsParamType

control_params¶

The parameters of the control law to be used in simulation

Type:

Vector field that the vehicle will use to avoid obstacles while traversing to the goal

Type:

world¶

World in which the vehicle is operating

Type:

PolygonWorld

sensor¶

The sensor used for detecting obstacles

Type:

RangeBearingSensor

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions.

Updates performed:

  • Calculate the range and bearing measurements

  • Calculate the resulting vector to be followed

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.NavVectorFollower(dynamics: Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], controller: VectorControl[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType], dynamic_params: DynamicsParamType, control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[LocationStateType], vector_field: G2GAvoid, world: PolygonWorld, sensor: RangeBearingSensor, carrot: LineCarrot | None, params: SimParameters[LocationStateType])¶

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions.

The following updates are performed:

  • Calculate the range and bearing measurements

  • Update the goal location if carrot-following

  • Calculate the resulting vector to be followed

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

update_dynamics() → None¶

Updates the control and dynamics

The following updates are performed:

  • Update the goal location if carrot-following

  • Calculate the resulting vector to be followed

  • Calculate the control to be executed

  • Update the state

  • Update the time

update_sensing() → None¶

Updates the range and bearing measurements

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.SimpleSim(dynamics: Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], controller: Control[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType], dynamic_params: DynamicsParamType, control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[LocationStateType], params: SimParameters[LocationStateType])¶

Bases: Generic[LocationStateType, InputType, ControlParamType, DynamicsParamType], SingleAgentSim[LocationStateType]

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.SingleAgentSim(n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[StateType], params: SimParameters[StateType])¶

Bases: Generic[StateType]

Implements the main functions for a single agent simulation

params¶

parameters for running the simulation

Type:

SimParameters

data¶

Stores the current and next slice of information

Type:

Data

lock¶

Lock used for writing to the data

Type:

Lock

stop¶

Event used to indicate that the simulator should be stopped

Type:

Event

plots¶

The manifest of plots to be plotted

Type:

PlotManifest

initialize_data_storage(n_inputs: int) → None¶

Initializes all of the storage

Parameters:

n_inputs – The number of inputs for the control trajectory

post_process() → None¶

Process the results

store_data_slice(sim_slice: Slice[StateType]) → None¶

Stores the state trajectory data

Parameters:

sim_slice – The information to be stored

update() → None¶

Performs all the required updates

update_plot() → None¶

Plot the current values and state. Should be done with the lock on to avoid updating current while plotting the data

class py_sim.sim.sim_modes.VectorFollower(dynamics: Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType], controller: VectorControl[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType, ControlParamType], dynamic_params: DynamicsParamType, control_params: ControlParamType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[LocationStateType], vector_field: VectorField, params: SimParameters[LocationStateType])¶

Bases: Generic[LocationStateType, InputType, ControlParamType, DynamicsParamType], SingleAgentSim[LocationStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that uses a vector field for feedback

dynamics¶

The dynamics function to be used for simulation

Type:

Dynamics[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType]

controller¶

The control law to be used during simulation

Type:

VectorControl[LocationStateType, InputType, DynamicsParamType ControlParamType]

dynamic_params¶

Fixed parameters for the dynamics

Type:

DynamicsParamType

control_params¶

The parameters of the control law to be used in simulation

Type:

ControlParamType

vector_field¶

Vector field that the vehicle will follow

Type:

VectorField

update() → None¶

Calls all of the updates in the sim.

The following are updated:

  • Calculates the desired vector

  • Calculate the control to follow the vector

  • Update the state

  • Update the time
